meanings.definition: A unit of electric charge equal to the charge carried by one mole of electrons.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that a faraday is a measure of electric charge.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the electricity in faradays to understand the charge.
meanings.sent3: Why did the electron bring a suitcase to the faraday party? To carry its charge!
meanings.sent4: The faraday of excitement in the air was palpable as the experiment began.
meanings.sent5: The faraday of electrons danced around the nucleus, creating a beautiful charge.

meanings.definition: A British scientist who contributed to the fields of electromagnetism and electrochemistry.
meanings.sent1: Faraday's discoveries in electromagnetism revolutionized the field.
meanings.sent2: The students studied Faraday's experiments in science class.
meanings.sent3: Why did Faraday refuse to eat the electrochemistry cake? He was too shocked!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for science was as strong as Faraday's dedication to his work.
meanings.sent5: The classroom buzzed with excitement as the teacher discussed Faraday's achievements.
